body:
What ZAP version are you using?

Does that happen with the default policy? Are you scanning a context?

I am using 2.4.3 but it was present in 2.4.2 also (reporting now as i assumed it may be fixed in .3) Having a Context with the Host included. Then right click active scan on the root of the site. Using default policy or any custom one (which have the SQL Injection enabled)
Are all the technologies of the context enabled? That scanner is (automatically) skipped if DB technology is not enabled.
Technologies are unchanged.. so DB is enabled (by default)
OK, not sure why it's being skipped. Could you provide/take a look at the log?
Of course.. you will get your logs tomorrow when back at the office.

Thank you.
btw, you should try running ZAP with a clean directory (with "-dir" option [1]).
That should give more clues to where the issue is.

[1] https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-core-help/wiki/HelpCmdline

Here is the log:

```
2015-12-08 08:01:12,360 [Thread-297] INFO  HostProcess - completed host/plugin http://10.202.0.147 | TestCrossSiteScriptV2 in 0.468s
2015-12-08 08:01:12,360 [Thread-297] DEBUG ActiveScan - Plugin 40012 total # reqs: 17
2015-12-08 08:01:12,610 [Thread-297] INFO  HostProcess - skipped plugin http://10.202.0.147 | TestSQLInjection in 0s
2015-12-08 08:01:12,672 [Thread-297] INFO  HostProcess - start host http://10.202.0.147 | CodeInjectionPlugin strength MEDIUM threshold MEDIUM
```

I am able to reproduce it now:

Open ZAP
Proxy a Page
Add it to the default context
Start Active scan with default context
-> SQL skipped
Scan Site without Context -> SQL executed
Modify Context, uncheck the DB Technology and reenable it (even though its already enabled) -> SQL executed!
So it looks like there is a problem with reading the defaults from the context.
Also appears when using a new Context without touching the Technology Settings

Having a look at the context files i found a possible cause:

This is the default Tech section of a context:

```
<include>Db.Firebird</include>
<include>Db.HypersonicSQL</include>
<include>Db.IBM DB2</include>
<include>Db.Microsoft Access</include>
<include>Db.Microsoft SQL Server</include>
<include>Db.MySQL</include>
<include>Db.Oracle</include>
<include>Db.PostgreSQL</include>
<include>Db.SAP MaxDB</include>
<include>Db.SQLite</include>
<include>Db.Sybase</include>
<include>Language.ASP</include>
<include>Language.C</include>
<include>Language.PHP</include>
<include>Language.XML</include>
<include>OS.Linux</include>
<include>OS.MacOS</include>
<include>OS.Windows</include>
<include>SCM.Git</include>
<include>SCM.SVN</include>
<include>WS.Apache</include>
<include>WS.IIS</include>
<include>WS.Tomcat</include>
<exclude>Db</exclude>
<exclude>Language</exclude>
<exclude>OS</exclude>
<exclude>SCM</exclude>
<exclude>WS</exclude>
```

But why are there 5 excludes? In the GUI is everything enabled. When unchecking the technologies and reenabling them as described above the excludes disappear
Thanks, that's caused by a problem in the selection state of technology tree.

issue.title: Update parent nodes' state when un/checking tree nodes programmatically

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change methods JCheckBoxTree.checkSubTree(TreePath, boolean) and
check(TreePath, boolean) to update parent nodes' checked state (through
updatePredecessorsAllChildrenSelectedState(TreePath)), to ensure that
parent's children checked state ("allChildrenSelected") is up to date
thus correctly report when fully checked (the node itself and the child
nodes).
Extracted a helper method, allSelected(CheckedNode), that tells if all
child nodes and the node itself is selected based on a checked state.
Add method, isChecked(TreePath), that tells whether or not a node is
checked, useful for testing and actual tree usage.
Add tests to assert the expected behaviour.
Fix #2110 - SQL Injection gets skipped

issue.title: Initialise Technology tab with selected context in Active Scan dialogue

milestone.description: Enhancements and bug fixes expected to be included in the next main release.

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Initialise Technology tab with selected context in Active Scan dialogue and fix selection
issues (like #1708 and #2110).

---

Issue reported in OWASP ZAP User Group: https://groups.google.com/d/msg/zaproxy-users/q7NbD7J-d0Y/MtmiABegBgAJ

body:
I am facing a similar (same?) issue with ZAP 2.5.0 (on Mac, if it matters). To be specific, if at least one DB technology is unchecked in the context (can be any DB technology), SQL Injection scan is always skipped. Otherwise (all DB technologies checked) it runs.
Is it a bug or a feature ?
Looks likely a bug, but make sure that the add-ons are up-to-date (it could be zaproxy/zap-extensions#439, fixed in version 24 of Active scanner rules add-on).

Thank you for your quick reply !
After updating all addons and installing Active Scanner Rules (beta), the problem is gone.
Cheers
Great, thanks for letting us know!
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
